bill_title: limit the use of information contained in certain commitment documentation related to drug offenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict the liability for criminal prosecution arising out of the detainment or commitment of certain persons during drug related protective custody, emergency commitment, and involuntary commitment proceedings. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 34-20A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person detained or committed pursuant to § 34-20A-55, 34-20A-63, or 34-20A-70 is liable to criminal prosecution arising out of such detainment or commitment process if the person detained or committed: (1) Was not, prior to detainment or commitment, in custody on drug charges or was not, at the time of detainment or commitment, currently charged with any drug violation; and (2) Waives his or her right to hearing pursuant to chapter 34-20A; and (3) Willingly stipulates and consents to involuntary placement for drug treatment; and (4) Successfully completes drug treatment and complies with such aftercare conditions as may be ordered by the court. Section 2. That chapter 34-20A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any person is detained or committed under such circumstances as are described in section 1 of this Act, any evidence of any drug violation seized during any legal search of the person or the person's residence, vehicle, immediate surroundings, or personal belongings shall be suppressed if such evidence is seized: (1) During a search predicated on information volunteered as part of an application or affidavit for involuntary commitment; or (2) During the execution of a protective custody order or as a continuation of the execution of a protective custody order. Section 3. That chapter 34-20A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person who petitions or applies pursuant to § 34-20A-55, 34-20A-63, or 34-20A-70 for the detainment or commitment of some other person is liable to criminal prosecution arising out of such detainment or commitment process.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the use of information contained in certain commitment documentation related to drug offenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 34-20A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The petition for commitment, written application, and written report to the circuit court and the resulting protective custody order required by § 34-20A-70 shall be sealed and may not be used for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of chapter 22-42 and chapter 22-42A against the person being committed. Any law enforcement official or prosecuting attorney may petition the circuit court to examine these documents, and the court may allow such examination upon a showing that the purpose of the examination is not to investigate a violation of chapter 22-42 or chapter 22-42A against the person being committed. However, no information contained in the petition for commitment, written application, written report, or protective custody order may be used against the person being committed in any prosecution for a violation of chapter 22-42 or chapter 22-42A. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
